intro: Cola bipindensis, commonly known as African cola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sterculiaceae. It is native to tropical West Africa, where it grows in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of caffeine. The botanical features of Cola bipindensis make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
